title: Carol Vorderman's mum reveals heartbreaking reason she won't have treatment for her terminal cancer
text:
Showbiz Carol Vorderman's mum reveals heartbreaking reason she won't have treatment for her terminal cancer The TV star has described her mum as “beautiful inside and out” as she told of her devastating diagnosis Share Carol with her mum, Jean, who has been diagnosed with terminal cancer (Photo: Twitter/carolvorders) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Carol Vorderman “refused to be sad” as she celebrated mothers’ day - days after mum Jean was diagnosed with terminal cancer. 
Describing her mum as “beautiful inside and out”, Carol ’s family “concentrated on being happy” during their day together, on the instruction of 88-year-old Jean. 
The I’m A Celebrity star, 56, rushed Jean to the Bristol Royal Infirmary the previous weekend, as she was suffering intense pain. 
The 88-year-old, who has previously survived cancer three times, underwent several tests which revealed she has multiple tumours. 
Sadly, she has been told this cancer is not curable. Carl Vorderman's mum, Jean, celebrates Mother's Day with her family (Photo: Twitter/carolvorders) 
Jean told the Mirror: “At my age I don’t want to undergo any further operations or chemotherapy treatment which can’t cure these new cancers anyway. 
“Now my family and me will concentrate on being happy and celebrating the time we have together. I’m refusing to let them be sad.” 
“I love her beyond measure,” said Carol, who is now caring for her mum in Bristol, along with her brother and sister. Carol and her mum Jean, who has already battled cancer three times (Photo: Rex Features) 
The family spent the day having a special lunch with all Jean’s family near her home with her children, grandchildren and her one great grandchild all attending. 
Carol, 56, told the Mirror: “We are laughing so much and she is having a lovely time. She refuses to let us be sad so we are taking our lead from her.” 
Carol posted on Twitter: “A precious Mother’s Day. 
“This week Mum & I found out she has terminal cancer. She’s 88, beautiful inside and out & I love her beyond measure.” 
Posting an image of the family together, she added: “Mum’s lunch with all her children, all her grandchildren and her gorgeous great grandchild Alex. Lots of laughing.” 
Over the past 14 years, Jean has beaten cancer three times. 
In her 2010 autobiography, Carol said the family were “rocked” and “in a state of turmoil” when they first discovered Jean had ovarian cancer in 2003, after falling ill over Christmas. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
